meanings.definition: Not likely to give way or overturn; firmly fixed.
meanings.sent1: The table was the stablest piece of furniture in the room.
meanings.sent2: The foundation of the house was the stablest part, ensuring its durability.
meanings.sent3: The stablest chair in the house was the one with three legs instead of four.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was the stablest anchor in his turbulent life.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood as the stablest symbol of strength and resilience in the forest.

meanings.definition: Not likely to change or fail; firmly established.
meanings.sent1: The stablest rule in our house is to always be kind to others.
meanings.sent2: Their love was the stablest bond, unshaken by any storm.
meanings.sent3: The stablest routine in his life was eating cereal for breakfast every day.
meanings.sent4: Her belief in herself was the stablest foundation for success.
meanings.sent5: The stablest rock in the garden represented their unwavering commitment to each other.

meanings.sent1: The stablest umbrella shielded her from the pouring rain.
meanings.sent2: His resolve was the stablest during times of adversity.
meanings.sent3: The stablest backpack carried all his school books without tearing.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was the stablest when dealing with difficult customers.
meanings.sent5: The stablest ship weathered the fiercest of storms without faltering.
